attributes.action: Make it compulsory for facts in political comms to be substantiated and reviewed
attributes.additional_details: We should require substantiation, and independent review and approval, for any political advertising. The ASA should also be compelled to broaden their mandate to include political ads. This would prevent the misrepresentation of facts and allow people to make better political decisions. The recent EU referendum, and regret from some parties, is testament to the fact that, currently, people feel they are not getting all the information and are being misled, manipulated or simply lied to.
attributes.background: In brand ads claims about products/services have to be substantiated and approved by independent bodies (eg ASA) This allows people to make factually informed choices. Political messages are exempted, and this is largely responsible for the misinformation of EU referendum. This should be changed.
